9.text: Best lady organist I’ve ever had.

12.text: Pulls out all the stops, does she?

15.text: How did you entertain our friend?

18.text: We took him out for a drink.

19.text: Oh? Where did you take him?

22.text: We dropped him off Hammersmith Bridge.

23.text: That should have quenched his thirst!

27.text:
I may be a poor defenceless woman, but any
more of your lip and I shall kick you from

34.text: here to the Elephant and Castle!

76.text:
“Sir Freddie Laker says he hopes to be back
in business with ‘a people’s airline’.

104.text:
Good evening. Sir Freddy Laker broke his silence

112.text:
His announcement came, he said, because of
the great support he’s received over the

115.text:
last few days and the Ser… Suv… Save Sir
Freddie Funds.

120.text: He said he was deeply grateful, and went on:

122.text:
“As a result of the enormous public support
I am actively exploring a new airline project.

128.text:
“And future plans include public participation,
‘the people’s airline’.”

131.text:
Sir Freddie’s startling new plans were announced
as the receivers were beginning to sell off

137.text:
the package holiday side of his organisation.
This afternoon the receiver, Mr Bill Mackie,

145.text:
There’s no indication so far as to whether
the receivers have found a purchaser or not.

150.text: Clive Ferguson reports now on the offers.
